title: 2009년 Yates 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Yates. 판결일: 2009-11-23. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Michael A. YATES, Petitioner—Appellant, v. Keith DAVIS, Warden, Respondent—Appellee
**판결일**: 2009-11-23
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Gregory, Hamilton, Per Curiam, Wilkinson

## 변호인

Michael A. Yates, Appellant Pro Se.

## 인용

- 352 F. App'x 815

## 판결문 요약

                              UNPUBLISHED

                    UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS
                        FOR THE FOURTH CIRCUIT


                              No. 09-7474


MICHAEL A. YATES,

                  Petitioner – Appellant,

             v.

KEITH DAVIS, Warden,

                  Respondent – Appellee.



Appeal from the United States District Court for the Eastern
District of Virginia, at Alexandria.   T. S. Ellis, III, Senior
District Judge. (1:08-cv-01284-TSE-IDD)


Submitted:    November 16, 2009             Decided:   November 23, 2009


Before WILKINSON and      GREGORY,   Circuit    Judges,   and   HAMILTON,
Senior Circuit Judge.


Remanded by unpublished per curiam opinion.


Michael A. Yates, Appellant Pro Se.


Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.
 PER CURIAM:

           Michael A. Yates seeks to appeal the district court’s

order dismissing his petition filed pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 2254

(2006).        The     district   court      entered     its         order     on

February 24, 2009.      We deem Yates to have filed his notice of

appeal no later than July 30, 2009, and perhaps earlier. *                   Yates

argues that he did not receive notice of the district court’s

order until July 20, 2009.

           Parties are accorded thirty days after the entry of

the district court’s final judgment or order to note an appeal,

Fed. R. App. P. 4(a)(1)(A), unless the district court extends

the appeal period...

sources.name: Harvard Law - Case Law Access Project
